title: How to Make Scented Hand Sanitizer

steps.headline: Fill a clean bowl with 2/3 cup (160 milliliters) of rubbing alcohol.
steps.description: Try to use 99% rubbing alcohol instead of the regular 70%, as it will kill more germs.

steps.headline: Add 1/3 cup (80 grams) of Aloe Vera gel.
steps.description: This will give the hand sanitizer that gel-like texture. It will also take away some of the harshness of the rubbing alcohol and make it less drying by moisturizing your hands.

steps.headline: Add 8 to 10 drops of your favorite essential oil.
steps.description: You can use any scent you'd like, but the following scents have antimicrobial properties: cinnamon, clove, eucalyptus, lavender, peppermint, rosemary, thyme, or thieves.

steps.headline: Stir the ingredients together using a spatula until everything is smooth.
steps.description: There should be no lumps or clumps.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture into a clean bottle, using a funnel to guide you.
steps.description: Try to use a bottle with a pump or squeeze top. Take the cap off and insert the funnel. Pour the mixture through the funnel and into the bottle. Use the spatula to scrape everything out of the bowl.

steps.headline: Close the bottle and give it a final shake.
steps.description: Your scented hand sanitizer is now ready to use. The ingredients may settle over time. If this happens, simply give the bottle another shake.

steps.headline: Add 5 to 10 drops of your favorite essential oil into a clean bowl.
steps.description: You can use any type you'd like, but the following oils have antimicrobial properties: cinnamon, clove, eucalyptus, lavender, peppermint, rosemary, thyme, or thieves.

steps.headline: Stir in 30 drops of tea tree essential oil and ¼ teaspoon (1.25 milliliters) of Vitamin E oil.
steps.description: The tea tree oil will act as an antiseptic, while the Vitamin E oil will act as a preservative. It will also leave your hands feeling soft and smooth.

steps.headline: Stir in 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) of witch hazel.
steps.description: This will help kill all of the germs without the harshness of rubbing alcohol. Keep in mind that witch hazel is not as effective as rubbing alcohol; if you'd like something stronger, use a high-proof vodka instead.

steps.headline: Add 1 cup (225 grams) of Ale Vera gel.
steps.description: This will help give your hand sanitizer that gel-like consistency. It will also make it less drying and more moisturizing.

steps.headline: Stir the mixture with your spatula until everything is smooth.
steps.description: There should be no lumps or clumps left.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture into a clean bottle with a pump or squeeze top.
steps.description: Take the cap off first, then stick a funnel down into the neck. Pour the mixture into the funnel. Use your spatula to help guide the mixture.

steps.headline: Close the bottle, and shake it before using it.
steps.description: Try to use the your  sanitizer within a few months. This hand sanitizer is natural and pure, so it does not contain any preservatives.
